place.name: SPRINGTHORPE
place.gazetteerText: SPRINGTHORPE, a parish in Gainsborough district, Lincoln; 4 miles E of Gainsborough r. station. Post town, Gainsborough. Acres, 1,072. Real property, £1,796. Pop., 260. Houses, 59. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £150. Patron, the Lord Chancellor. There are chapels for Wesleyan and Primitive Methodists. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
